SEARCH
Package Domain

Class InputController

java.lang.Object
Domain.InputController
public class InputController extends Object
The InputController class manages the creation and manipulation of Alphabets and TransitionMatrices. It ensures unique keys for Alphabets and TransitionMatrices and provides methods for creating and deleting them.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputController

      public InputController(Vector<Pair<String,char[]>> alphabetsData, Vector<Pair<Pair<String,String>,int[][]>> transitionsData) throws NotContainsKey
      Default constructor for the InputController class. Initializes the maps for Alphabets and TransitionMatrices.
      Parameters:
      alphabetsData - The initial data for Alphabets.
      transitionsData - The initial data for TransitionMatrices.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If a required key is not present in the data structures.

  • Method Details

    • createAlphabet

      public void createAlphabet(String keyAlphabet, char[] elem) throws ContainsKey, IncorrectType
      Creates an Alphabet with the specified key and elements.
      Parameters:
      keyAlphabet - The key associated with the new Alphabet.
      elem - The elements of the Alphabet.
      Throws:
      ContainsKey - If the specified key is already present in the data structures.
      IncorrectType - If the specified key has an incorrect type.

    • deleteAlphabet

      public void deleteAlphabet(String keyAlpha) throws NotContainsKey
      Deletes an Alphabet with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      keyAlpha - The key associated with the Alphabet to be deleted.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not present in the data structures.

    • getAlphabet

      public Alphabet getAlphabet(String alphaKey) throws NotContainsKey
      Retrieves an Alphabet with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      alphaKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      Returns:
      The Alphabet corresponding to the key, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not present in the data structures.

    • checkAlphabetUsed

      public boolean checkAlphabetUsed(String alphaKey)
      Checks if an Alphabet with the specified key is used in any TransitionMatrix.
      Parameters:
      alphaKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      Returns:
      True if the Alphabet is used, false otherwise.

    • addElemAlphabet

      public void addElemAlphabet(String alphaKey, char elem) throws NotContainsKey, IncorrectAlphabetType
      Adds an element to an Alphabet.
      Parameters:
      alphaKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      elem - The element to add.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not found.
      IncorrectAlphabetType - If the specified key has an incorrect type.

    • delElemAlphabet

      public void delElemAlphabet(String alphaKey, char elem) throws IncorrectAlphabetType, NotContainsKey
      Deletes an element from an Alphabet.
      Parameters:
      alphaKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      elem - The element to delete.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not found.
      IncorrectAlphabetType - If the specified key has an incorrect type.

    • createMatrixText

      public void createMatrixText(String alphabetKey, String textKey, String textIn) throws ContainsKey, NotContainsKey, IncorrectType, StringNotInAlphabet
      Creates a TransitionMatrix from a text with the specified Alphabet key and Text key.
      Parameters:
      alphabetKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      textKey - The key associated with the new TransitionMatrix.
      textIn - The input text for creating the TransitionMatrix.
      Throws:
      ContainsKey - If the specified key already exist.
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not found.
      IncorrectType - If the specified key has an incorrect type.
      StringNotInAlphabet - If the specified word is not in the alphabet.

    • createMatrixFrequencyList

      public void createMatrixFrequencyList(String alphabetKey, String transKey, int[] frequenciesList, String[] wordsList) throws ContainsKey, NotContainsKey, IncorrectType, StringNotInAlphabet
      Creates a TransitionMatrix from a frequency list with the specified Alphabet key and TransitionMatrix key.
      Parameters:
      alphabetKey - The key associated with the Alphabet.
      transKey - The key associated with the new TransitionMatrix.
      frequenciesList - The list of frequencies for creating the TransitionMatrix.
      wordsList - The list of words for creating the TransitionMatrix.
      Throws:
      ContainsKey - If the specified key already exist.
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not found.
      IncorrectType - If the specified key has an incorrect type.
      StringNotInAlphabet - If the specified word is not in the alphabet.

    • deleteTransitionMatrix

      public void deleteTransitionMatrix(String keyTrans) throws NotContainsKey
      Deletes a TransitionMatrix with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      keyTrans - The key associated with the TransitionMatrix to be deleted.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If the specified key is not found.

    • getTransitionMatrix

      public TransitionMatrix getTransitionMatrix(String transKey) throws NotContainsKey
      Gets a TransitionMatrix with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      transKey - The key associated with the TransitionMatrix.
      Returns:
      The TransitionMatrix corresponding to the key.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If it does not exist a Transition Matrix with that key.

    • listAlphabets

      public Alphabet[] listAlphabets()
      Retrieves an array of Alphabets stored in the InputController.
      Returns:
      An array of Alphabets, where each element represents an Alphabet in the InputController.

    • listTransitionMatrix

      public TransitionMatrix[] listTransitionMatrix()
      Retrieves an array of TransitionMatrices stored in the InputController.
      Returns:
      An array of TransitionMatrices, where each element represents a TransitionMatrix in the InputController.
